intro: Nephralles parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered nephralles, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Nephralles parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
